item.description:
Turtle Pond Parkway, West Roxbury, Hyde Park.
617-333-7404

Open year-round, dawn to dusk. Enneking, Dedham and Turtle Pond Parkways wind through extensive tree covered hills, valleys, rock-outcroppings and wetlands; past Turtle Pond and into Hyde Park. Stony Brook Reservation contains 475 acres of scenic landscapes and a variety of recreational facilities.

Ten to twelve miles of hiking trails and bicycle paths meander through the quiet, forested portion of the reservation. Sunfish and Perch swim in the fresh waters of Turtle Pond, an easily accessible spot for fishing.

Directions:
MBTA: Orange line to Forest Hills Station, MBTA bus (Dedham) to Turtle Pond Parkways.

By Car: From Washington Street at Forest Hills Station, 3 miles on Washington Street, towards Dedham, left onto Turtle Pond Parkway.

Meet at the Turtle Pond parking area on Enneking Pkwy.

Check out the map at this site:

http://www.mass.gov/d...

Afterwards we will go for lunch at:

Tai Ho Restaurant
1727 Centre St, West Roxbury, MA
617-327-8060

Need a ride? I can pick you up at Forest Hills T station, at 10. Meet inside the station's lobby by the donut shop. You can aslo consider adding a note to your RSVP asking for a ride.
item.name: Stony Brook Reservation walk
